info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 28 at 5:50PM CDT until April 28 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MEDINA...EASTERN BANDERA...NORTHWESTERN CALDWELL... SOUTHEASTERN KERR...HAYS...NORTHWESTERN GUADALUPE...SOUTH CENTRAL TRAVIS...SOUTHWESTERN BLANCO...KENDALL...NORTHWESTERN BEXAR AND COMAL COUNTIES... At 549 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Buda to near Lakehills, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported Golf Ball size hail in downtown Bandera at 5:30 PM. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, San Marcos, Schertz, Kyle, Buda, Boerne, Lockhart, Selma, Dripping Springs, Wimberley, Bandera, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, Shavano Park and Hollywood Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms are producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
